intro: Psychotria palauensis, commonly known as the Palau psychotria, is a species of flowering plant native to the island nation of Palau in the western Pacific. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its small, dark green leaves and clusters of small, white to pale yellow flowers. It thrives in humid, tropical environments and is often found in lowland forests. Due to its limited geographic range, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
